duck: Frobenius automorphism - In commutative algebra and field theory, the Frobenius endomorphism (after Ferdinand Georg Frobenius) is a special endomorphism of commutative rings with prime characteristic p, an important...
endomorphism ring - In abstract algebra, the endomorphism ring of an abelian group X, denoted by End, is the set of all homomorphisms of X into itself.
morphism - In many fields of mathematics, morphism refers to a structure-preserving mapping from one mathematical structure to another.

characteristic subgroup - In mathematics, particularly in the area of abstract algebra known as group theory, a characteristic subgroup is a subgroup that is invariant under all automorphisms of the parent group.
automorphism definition: an isomorphism of a set (as a group) with itself.
antiautomorphism - In mathematics, an antihomomorphism is a type of function defined on sets with multiplication that reverses the order of multiplication.
In mathematics, an automorphism is an isomorphism from a mathematical object to itself.

wiki.text:
In mathematics, an 'automorphism' is an isomorphism from a mathematical object
to itself. It is, in some sense, a symmetry of the object, and a way of mapping
the object to itself while preserving all of its structure. The set of all
automorphisms of an object forms a group, called the 'automorphism group'. It
is, loosely speaking, the symmetry group of the object.
wiki.title: automorphism
